label: Essay by Esau Jenkins regarding his work, probably for education class
description: Assignment completed by Jenkins discussing his work for the people of Johns Island and the creation of the Progressive Club.

metadata.value: Assignment completed by Jenkins discussing his work for the people of Johns Island and the creation of the Progressive Club.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
Wednesday Sept. 14, 1966. Mr.s Jamers English Class
My Biggest Problem in English is adding Esses [sic]
where. They should be added (Subject/Verb)

Write a compisition [sic]
Esau x 1. my job is enjoyable to me  my assignement work for Monday Setp. 21st.
2.
3. There is between a house and a home
4. Thing which annoy most

A Composition is a group of (relayed) [sic] paragraphs
developing a broad topic.
Composition on the (subject, I like my job.)
My job is working with Grass_Roots and underpriveleged depraved of Basic Rights through poverty.
people.  I like it because it is a challenge to me and each
time when I have been able to help groups as the above mention,
to achievd some of the things that they were deprive of or 
which make a life mor meaningfull and happy to them, makes me happier.

To make any kind of progress in life you should, 1st, get organized
2nd, Do away folly; 3rd, work together and 4th set 
your goalds [sic].

In 1948, I organized the group on Johns Isld,
called Progressive Club: for the purposes of getting 
parents who were living on other people's farms and plantations
to do away with folly and save their money until they
get enough to buy small lots, and build homes
for themselves; that their children will be able to stay in schools
we asked the county to build us a Consolidated School with
four year High School. Plus school bus transportations
for our children.  We bought an old building and set up a adult Citizenship

foll pg 184     A paragraph consist of 
one topic sentence
punch       "
Clincher    "
Write

School to teach older adulst who could not figure, read nor 
write; and others who were so limited in education.  This were great help.  More of them become
registered and voting Citizens.  This gave them a sense
of being Citizens that have to be reconized [sic] by
the other group who has been keeping them from getting
the things needed to make enjoyable happy lives. Because
of, the organization; the people did away with follish actions
or belief. Worked to gather as they procede me; and we reached the goals of which I promised could be
achieved by Cooperations.  They are more happier now
then ever.

In 1962, I suggested we build a building large
enough to house a store, Gymn [sic], and sleeping quarters.
This was groc,
Colothing [sic] and gas to our selves and the public; The children
for playing Basket Ball, Table Tenis [sic] and skating in 
the Gymn [sic]; plus we have workshops, Folks Song
fest, Speedup program and religous [sic] group meetings.
The Sleeping quarters sleep the people who attend
workshops and song fest.  Who live too far to 
attend daily workshop meetings.  This made them
prode [sic] of themselves.  They show it by expressions.
